name: mirror msg
info:
Build an update message for 'mirror' devices.

Used to process tuyaTRIGGERS.

- `deviceID`: the 'mirror' device ID or CID
- `fakeDP`: the data point id. Convention: user defined, equal to related tuyaTRIGGER, number (1000-2000). 
- `value`: the new value. If the value starts with '@', then it is eval()ued: exemple '@msg.payoad.set' => eval('msg.payoad.set'))

note: The 'mirror' device MUST exist in the `fake` branch of **alldevices**.

name: do mirror msg
red trigger
info:
Build a REDTRG msg for tuya_bridge device.

REDTRG values are in range 2000-3000 (convention)

Note: it uses dp 102 (for  [Switch MS-104]). 
Change the code if your tuya-bridge device uses a different dp.

name: send  X TRIGGER
connected
info:
Handles tuya device status changes.


Processes the status of a real device , if the connection status changes:
   - Creates a log msg (deviceId, "_connected", true/false) for standard processing
 
IMPORTANT: set the ** deviceID ** parameter with the correct ID value.

name: device connected message

label: tuyaDAEMON.triggers
info:
**addon for tuyaDAEMON flow**

This addon enables **tuyaDAEMON TRIGGERS** handling and extends tuyaDAEMON capabilities to get a very strict integration of tuya-cloud with node-red.

_Triggers can be used:_
 - to reflect in _node-red_ some **tuya events** from devices and sensors that are not caught by the _tuya-smart-device_ node, e.g. WiFi battery-powered sensors (`mirroring TRIGGER`)
 
 - to perform a ** command or smart action ** (automation) on tuya (_smartlife_), activated by _node-red_ (`REDTRIGGER`)
 
 - to run a **flow on node-red ** activated by tuya (_smartlife_), in Smart Scene Automation (`TUYATRIGGER`), due to user actions or weather conditions, geolocation or changes in the status of the tuya devices.
 
 - to fire a **node-red flow** when a device message satisfies some conditions, even more complex than those expressed in _smartlife_. (`EVNTRIGGER`)

 
**Precondition:**

Requires a _real device_ having a big unused parameter, writable from both Tuya and node-red.

_I chose the_ Switch MS-104 _because its countdown parameter is with a large range [0-86400] and still this device can be used as WiFi switch. Plus it is small and cheap._

name: tuyaTRIGGERS
info:
## TRIGGER tuyaDEAMON module

_A real device WiFI, having  a big unused numerical parameter, say a 'counter', writable for both **Tuya** and **node-red**, is all the required hardware to implement a robust bilateral event communication (**TRIGGER**)._

see   https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/blob/main/tuyaTRIGGER/README.md

name: TUYATRGXXX
info:
selects all TRIGGERS from tuya cloud (values: 801-1999), to more prosesses
select test pig values (0-799) (optional)

name: ACK  process
_system :  trigger related cmds
info:
device: _system property: _trgPing

This flow implements a trigger ping test (optional).
A refresh can be triggered using the inject node or a standard user GET command.
Do it in a quiet moment to avoid interferences.
Sets node name to required pings number for the test

name: _system cmd selector
info:
Select GET/SET/SCHEMA/MULTIPLE  commands 
for 'fake' device

Implementation:

"_system":"_trgPing" accepts only GET: fires a data refresh.
             
The stadard GET tuyaDAEMON request
````
    msg.payload:{
        "device":"_system", 
        "property":"_trgPing"  
        } 
````        
fires a flow that implements the command.
limit throughput, but allows smooth operations and less connection problems

name: Debug pad options
info:
**Disable unwonted trace messages on debug pad.**

 - Disable unwonted debug nodes.

**tuya_ms_104**   

_tuya bridge for "WiFi Smart Switch Module MS-104"_

After any command, this device sends (and this node captures) a 'status' message carring only the changed values.

A command can be send by node-red, SmartLife app, Google home, Google voice: in any case this node captures the status message.

_note:_
 If node-red changes the switch state, SmartLife is updated correctly, but Google Home not.
 
_Input:_
To send a command via node-red. the payload structure can be:
` multiple: true
  data: object
    1: true
    102: 5`

_nb:_
set **Device Virtual ID** and **Device Key** to a tuya connected and working switch, model M-104 ( see [https://it.aliexpress.com/wholesale?SearchText=smart+switch+ms+104](https://it.aliexpress.com/wholesale?SearchText=smart+switch+ms+104)).
